document.discussion_title: Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh puppets debut in second series of Newzoids
document.topic_text: Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh puppets debut in second series of Newzoids Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh puppets debut in second series of Newzoids New puppets of The X Factor judges Louis Walsh and Nicole Scherzinger will debut in the second series of satirical sketch show Newzoids. They join existing puppets of fellow judges Simon Cowell and Sharon Osbourne. (ITV) Nicole’s puppet is clad in a leopard print halterneck gown with long flowing brown hair, while Louis is sporting a purple jacket and shirt, with coiffed grey hair and white eyebrows. (ITV) They join the new puppets of Theresa May, Jeremy Corbyn and Princess Charlotte, which were unveiled last week. Former X Factor judges Cheryl and Nick Grimshaw will also feature in the new series when it returns to ITV in September. Simon Cowell (ITV) Debra Stephenson will voice both Nicole and Sharon in the comedy show, while Jon Culshaw voices Simon and Lewis Macleod will voice Louis. Sharon Osbourne (ITV) Other puppets joining the topical animation sketch show for the six-part series include Adele, Donald Trump, Danny Dyer, Zayn Malik and Bear Grylls, adding to the 70 existing Newzoids characters which include the Queen and Ant and Dec. The X Factor returns to ITV on August 27. Promoted stories
